ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC LUA <INFILE='filename'> <RESTART> <TERMINATE>; 
    <SUBMIT <"assignment(s);">;> 
      Lua statements
    <ENDSUBMIT;>
    run; 
    
PROC LUA enables you to perform these tasks: 
  o run Lua code within a SAS session 
  o call most SAS functions within Lua statements 
  o call PROC FCMP functions within Lua statements 
  o submit SAS code from Lua 
  o call CAS actions 
    Note: Support for calling CAS actions was added in SAS 9.4M5. 
  o read VARCHAR data. 
    Note: Support for VARCHAR data was added in SAS Viya 3.3.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: INFILE= 'filename' 
      
Identifies a source file that contains Lua statements to run within a SAS session. SAS expects 
this file to end with a .lua file extension, but do not include the extension in the filename 
that you specify.
Resets the state of Lua code submissions for a SAS session.

Stops maintaining the Lua code state in memory and terminates the Lua state when the LUA procedure 
completes. Subsequent calls to the LUA procedure begin a new instance of the Lua code state.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax:  SUBMIT <'assignment(s);'>; 

Identifies the beginning of a block of Lua code. Enter Lua statements between the SUBMIT and 
ENDSUBMIT statements.

Optional Argument
assignment(s)
  identifies one or more macro variable assignments that are passed to the block of Lua statements.
